newsitem.title: INDONESIA: Modern Land denies link-up talk.
newsitem.headline: Modern Land denies link-up talk.

text.p: Indonesian property firm PT Modern Land on Wednesday denied market rumours of a possible link-up with foreign firms.
"We have no such plan," a company official told Reuters.
The official said the company had filed a reply to the Stock Exhange Supervisory Agency (Bapepam) on Wednesday, which had questioned the steep increase in its share price.
But he declined to gave details of the letter adding that the firm had no plans which not been announced to the public.
Modern Land was the most active stock on the Jakarta bourse by mid-afternoon, rising sharply on the rumours of a foreign tie-up, brokers said.
By 0800 GMT, the stock was up 325 rupiah to 2,200 rupiah after touching a high of 2,275 rupiah earlier with about 20.6 million shares changing hands.
It rose 450 rupiah to 1,875 on Tuesday.
Some brokers believed the price could touch 2,400 rupiah in this week because some firms seemed to be continously snapping up the stock.
